db:abstract.db:para: The Framebuffer Object 2 example demonstrates how to use the QGLFramebufferObject class to render into an off-screen buffer and use the contents as a texture in a QGLWidget.

db:article.db:programlisting:
HEADERS += glwidget.h SOURCES += glwidget.cpp main.cpp RESOURCES += framebufferobject2.qrc
QT += opengl widgets
# install target.path = $$[QT_INSTALL_EXAMPLES]/opengl/framebufferobject2 INSTALLS += target
contains(QT_CONFIG, opengles.) { contains(QT_CONFIG, angle): \ warning("Qt was built with ANGLE, which provides only OpenGL ES 2.0 on top of DirectX 9.0c") error("This example requires Qt to be configured with -opengl desktop") }
